00057 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LDLM
00058 
00059 #include <lustre_dlm.h>
00060 #include <obd_support.h>
00061 #include <obd_class.h>
00062 #include <lustre_lib.h>
00063 #include <libcfs/list.h>

00065 #include "ldlm_internal.h"
00066 
00067 int ldlm_flock_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc,
00068                             void *data, int flag);
00069 
00078 #define list_for_remaining_safe(pos, n, head) \
00079         for (n = pos->next; pos != (head); pos = n, n = pos->next)
00080 
00081 static inline int
00082 ldlm_same_flock_owner(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock *new)
00083 {
00084         return((new->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner ==
00085                 lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner) &&
00086                (new->l_export == lock->l_export));
00087 }
00088 
00089 static inline int
00090 ldlm_flocks_overlap(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock *new)
00091 {
00092         return((new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start <=
00093                 lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end) &&
00094                (new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end >=
00095                 lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start));
00096 }
00097 
00098 static inline void ldlm_flock_blocking_link(struct ldlm_lock *req,
00099                                             struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00100 {
00101         /* For server only */
00102         if (req->l_export == NULL)
00103                 return;
00104 
00105         LASSERT(hlist_unhashed(&req->l_exp_flock_hash));
00106 
00107         req->l_policy_data.l_flock.blocking_owner =
00108                 lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner;
00109         req->l_policy_data.l_flock.blocking_export =
00110                 lock->l_export;
00111         req->l_policy_data.l_flock.blocking_refs = 0;
00112 
00113         cfs_hash_add(req->l_export->exp_flock_hash,
00114                      &req->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner,
00115                      &req->l_exp_flock_hash);
00116 }
00117 
00118 static inline void ldlm_flock_blocking_unlink(struct ldlm_lock *req)
00119 {
00120         /* For server only */
00121         if (req->l_export == NULL)
00122                 return;
00123 
00124         check_res_locked(req->l_resource);
00125         if (req->l_export->exp_flock_hash != NULL &&
00126             !hlist_unhashed(&req->l_exp_flock_hash))
00127                 cfs_hash_del(req->l_export->exp_flock_hash,
00128                              &req->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner,
00129                              &req->l_exp_flock_hash);
00130 }
00131 
00132 static inline void
00133 ldlm_flock_destroy(struct ldlm_lock *lock, enum ldlm_mode mode, __u64 flags)
00134 {
00135         ENTRY;
00136 
00137         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "ldlm_flock_destroy(mode: %d, flags: "LPX64")",
00138                    mode, flags);
00139 
00140         /* Safe to not lock here, since it should be empty anyway */
00141         LASSERT(hlist_unhashed(&lock->l_exp_flock_hash));
00142 
00143         list_del_init(&lock->l_res_link);
00144         if (flags == LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC) {
00145                 /* client side - set a flag to prevent sending a CANCEL */
00146                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY | LDLM_FL_CBPENDING;
00147 
00148                 /* when reaching here, it is under lock_res_and_lock(). Thus,
00149                    need call the nolock version of ldlm_lock_decref_internal*/
00150                 ldlm_lock_decref_internal_nolock(lock, mode);
00151         }
00152 
00153         ldlm_lock_destroy_nolock(lock);
00154         EXIT;
00155 }
00156 
00167 struct ldlm_flock_lookup_cb_data {
00168         __u64 *bl_owner;
00169         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00170         struct obd_export *exp;
00171 };
00172 
00173 static int ldlm_flock_lookup_cb(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
00174                                 struct hlist_node *hnode, void *data)
00175 {
00176         struct ldlm_flock_lookup_cb_data *cb_data = data;
00177         struct obd_export *exp = cfs_hash_object(hs, hnode);
00178         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00179 
00180         lock = cfs_hash_lookup(exp->exp_flock_hash, cb_data->bl_owner);
00181         if (lock == NULL)
00182                 return 0;
00183 
00184         /* Stop on first found lock. Same process can't sleep twice */
00185         cb_data->lock = lock;
00186         cb_data->exp = class_export_get(exp);
00187 
00188         return 1;
00189 }
00190 
00191 static int
00192 ldlm_flock_deadlock(struct ldlm_lock *req, struct ldlm_lock *bl_lock)
00193 {
00194         struct obd_export *req_exp = req->l_export;
00195         struct obd_export *bl_exp = bl_lock->l_export;
00196         __u64 req_owner = req->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner;
00197         __u64 bl_owner = bl_lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner;
00198 
00199         /* For server only */
00200         if (req_exp == NULL)
00201                 return 0;
00202 
00203         class_export_get(bl_exp);
00204         while (1) {
00205                 struct ldlm_flock_lookup_cb_data cb_data = {
00206                                         .bl_owner = &bl_owner,
00207                                         .lock = NULL,
00208                                         .exp = NULL };
00209                 struct obd_export *bl_exp_new;
00210                 struct ldlm_lock *lock = NULL;
00211                 struct ldlm_flock *flock;
00212 
00213                 if (bl_exp->exp_flock_hash != NULL) {
00214                         cfs_hash_for_each_key(bl_exp->exp_obd->obd_nid_hash,
00215                                 &bl_exp->exp_connection->c_peer.nid,
00216                                 ldlm_flock_lookup_cb, &cb_data);
00217                         lock = cb_data.lock;
00218                 }
00219                 if (lock == NULL)
00220                         break;
00221 
00222                 class_export_put(bl_exp);
00223                 bl_exp = cb_data.exp;
00224 
00225                 LASSERT(req != lock);
00226                 flock = &lock->l_policy_data.l_flock;
00227                 LASSERT(flock->owner == bl_owner);
00228                 bl_owner = flock->blocking_owner;
00229                 bl_exp_new = class_export_get(flock->blocking_export);
00230                 class_export_put(bl_exp);
00231 
00232                 cfs_hash_put(bl_exp->exp_flock_hash, &lock->l_exp_flock_hash);
00233                 bl_exp = bl_exp_new;
00234 
00235                 if (bl_exp->exp_failed)
00236                         break;
00237 
00238                 if (bl_owner == req_owner &&
00239                     (bl_exp->exp_connection->c_peer.nid ==
00240                      req_exp->exp_connection->c_peer.nid)) {
00241                         class_export_put(bl_exp);
00242                         return 1;
00243                 }
00244         }
00245         class_export_put(bl_exp);
00246 
00247         return 0;
00248 }
00249 
00250 static void ldlm_flock_cancel_on_deadlock(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00251                                           struct list_head *work_list)
00252 {
00253         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "reprocess deadlock req=%p\n", lock);
00254 
00255         if ((exp_connect_flags(lock->l_export) &
00256                                 OBD_CONNECT_FLOCK_DEAD) == 0) {
00257                 CERROR("deadlock found, but client doesn't "
00258                                 "support flock canceliation\n");
00259         } else {
00260                 LASSERT(lock->l_completion_ast);
00261                 LASSERT(!ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock));
00262                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_AST_SENT | LDLM_FL_CANCEL_ON_BLOCK |
00263                         LDLM_FL_FLOCK_DEADLOCK;
00264                 ldlm_flock_blocking_unlink(lock);
00265                 ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
00266                 ldlm_add_ast_work_item(lock, NULL, work_list);
00267         }
00268 }
00269 
00288 int
00289 ldlm_process_flock_lock(struct ldlm_lock *req, __u64 *flags, int first_enq,
00290                         enum ldlm_error *err, struct list_head *work_list)
00291 {
00292         struct ldlm_resource *res = req->l_resource;
00293         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = ldlm_res_to_ns(res);
00294         struct list_head *tmp;
00295         struct list_head *ownlocks = NULL;
00296         struct ldlm_lock *lock = NULL;
00297         struct ldlm_lock *new = req;
00298         struct ldlm_lock *new2 = NULL;
00299         enum ldlm_mode mode = req->l_req_mode;
00300         int local = ns_is_client(ns);
00301         int added = (mode == LCK_NL);
00302         int overlaps = 0;
00303         int splitted = 0;
00304         const struct ldlm_callback_suite null_cbs = { NULL };
00305         ENTRY;
00306 
00307         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "flags "LPX64" owner "LPU64" pid %u mode %u start "
00308                LPU64" end "LPU64"\n", *flags,
00309                new->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner,
00310                new->l_policy_data.l_flock.pid, mode,
00311                req->l_policy_data.l_flock.start,
00312                req->l_policy_data.l_flock.end);
00313 
00314         *err = ELDLM_OK;
00315 
00316         if (local) {
00317                 /* No blocking ASTs are sent to the clients for
00318                  * Posix file & record locks */
00319                 req->l_blocking_ast = NULL;
00320         } else {
00321                 /* Called on the server for lock cancels. */
00322                 req->l_blocking_ast = ldlm_flock_blocking_ast;
00323         }
00324 
00325 reprocess:
00326         if ((*flags == LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC) || (mode == LCK_NL)) {
00327                 /* This loop determines where this processes locks start
00328                  * in the resource lr_granted list. */
00329                 list_for_each(tmp, &res->lr_granted) {
00330                         lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock,
00331                                               l_res_link);
00332                         if (ldlm_same_flock_owner(lock, req)) {
00333                                 ownlocks = tmp;
00334                                 break;
00335                         }
00336                 }
00337         } else {
00338                 int reprocess_failed = 0;
00339                 lockmode_verify(mode);
00340 
00341                 /* This loop determines if there are existing locks
00342                  * that conflict with the new lock request. */
00343                 list_for_each(tmp, &res->lr_granted) {
00344                         lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock,
00345                                               l_res_link);
00346 
00347                         if (ldlm_same_flock_owner(lock, req)) {
00348                                 if (!ownlocks)
00349                                         ownlocks = tmp;
00350                                 continue;
00351                         }
00352 
00353                         /* locks are compatible, overlap doesn't matter */
00354                         if (lockmode_compat(lock->l_granted_mode, mode))
00355                                 continue;
00356 
00357                         if (!ldlm_flocks_overlap(lock, req))
00358                                 continue;
00359 
00360                         if (!first_enq) {
00361                                 reprocess_failed = 1;
00362                                 if (ldlm_flock_deadlock(req, lock)) {
00363                                         ldlm_flock_cancel_on_deadlock(req,
00364                                                         work_list);
00365                                         RETURN(LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE);
00366                                 }
00367                                 continue;
00368                         }
00369 
00370                         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT) {
00371                                 ldlm_flock_destroy(req, mode, *flags);
00372                                 *err = -EAGAIN;
00373                                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00374                         }
00375 
00376                         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK) {
00377                                 ldlm_flock_destroy(req, mode, *flags);
00378                                 req->l_req_mode = lock->l_granted_mode;
00379                                 req->l_policy_data.l_flock.pid =
00380                                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.pid;
00381                                 req->l_policy_data.l_flock.start =
00382                                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start;
00383                                 req->l_policy_data.l_flock.end =
00384                                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end;
00385                                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_LOCK_CHANGED;
00386                                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00387                         }
00388 
00389                         /* add lock to blocking list before deadlock
00390                          * check to prevent race */
00391                         ldlm_flock_blocking_link(req, lock);
00392 
00393                         if (ldlm_flock_deadlock(req, lock)) {
00394                                 ldlm_flock_blocking_unlink(req);
00395                                 ldlm_flock_destroy(req, mode, *flags);
00396                                 *err = -EDEADLK;
00397                                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00398                         }
00399 
00400                         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_waiting, req);
00401                         *flags |= LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED;
00402                         RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00403                 }
00404                 if (reprocess_failed)
00405                         RETURN(LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE);
00406         }
00407 
00408         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK) {
00409                 ldlm_flock_destroy(req, mode, *flags);
00410                 req->l_req_mode = LCK_NL;
00411                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_LOCK_CHANGED;
00412                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00413         }
00414 
00415         /* In case we had slept on this lock request take it off of the
00416          * deadlock detection hash list. */
00417         ldlm_flock_blocking_unlink(req);
00418 
00419         /* Scan the locks owned by this process that overlap this request.
00420          * We may have to merge or split existing locks. */
00421 
00422         if (!ownlocks)
00423                 ownlocks = &res->lr_granted;
00424 
00425         list_for_remaining_safe(ownlocks, tmp, &res->lr_granted) {
00426                 lock = list_entry(ownlocks, struct ldlm_lock, l_res_link);
00427 
00428                 if (!ldlm_same_flock_owner(lock, new))
00429                         break;
00430 
00431                 if (lock->l_granted_mode == mode) {
00432                         /* If the modes are the same then we need to process
00433                          * locks that overlap OR adjoin the new lock. The extra
00434                          * logic condition is necessary to deal with arithmetic
00435                          * overflow and underflow. */
00436                         if ((new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start >
00437                              (lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end + 1))
00438                             && (lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end !=
00439                                 OBD_OBJECT_EOF))
00440                                 continue;
00441 
00442                         if ((new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end <
00443                              (lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start - 1))
00444                             && (lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start != 0))
00445                                 break;
00446 
00447                         if (new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start <
00448                             lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start) {
00449                                 lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start =
00450                                         new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start;
00451                         } else {
00452                                 new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start =
00453                                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start;
00454                         }
00455 
00456                         if (new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end >
00457                             lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end) {
00458                                 lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end =
00459                                         new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end;
00460                         } else {
00461                                 new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end =
00462                                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end;
00463                         }
00464 
00465                         if (added) {
00466                                 ldlm_flock_destroy(lock, mode, *flags);
00467                         } else {
00468                                 new = lock;
00469                                 added = 1;
00470                         }
00471                         continue;
00472                 }
00473 
00474                 if (new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start >
00475                     lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end)
00476                         continue;
00477 
00478                 if (new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end <
00479                     lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start)
00480                         break;
00481 
00482                 ++overlaps;
00483 
00484                 if (new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start <=
00485                     lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start) {
00486                         if (new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end <
00487                             lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end) {
00488                                 lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start =
00489                                         new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end + 1;
00490                                 break;
00491                         }
00492                         ldlm_flock_destroy(lock, lock->l_req_mode, *flags);
00493                         continue;
00494                 }
00495                 if (new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end >=
00496                     lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end) {
00497                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end =
00498                                 new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start - 1;
00499                         continue;
00500                 }
00501 
00502                 /* split the existing lock into two locks */
00503 
00504                 /* if this is an F_UNLCK operation then we could avoid
00505                  * allocating a new lock and use the req lock passed in
00506                  * with the request but this would complicate the reply
00507                  * processing since updates to req get reflected in the
00508                  * reply. The client side replays the lock request so
00509                  * it must see the original lock data in the reply. */
00510 
00511                 /* XXX - if ldlm_lock_new() can sleep we should
00512                  * release the lr_lock, allocate the new lock,
00513                  * and restart processing this lock. */
00514                 if (new2 == NULL) {
00515                         unlock_res_and_lock(req);
00516                         new2 = ldlm_lock_create(ns, &res->lr_name, LDLM_FLOCK,
00517                                                 lock->l_granted_mode, &null_cbs,
00518                                                 NULL, 0, LVB_T_NONE);
00519                         lock_res_and_lock(req);
00520                         if (IS_ERR(new2)) {
00521                                 ldlm_flock_destroy(req, lock->l_granted_mode,
00522                                                    *flags);
00523                                 *err = PTR_ERR(new2);
00524                                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00525                         }
00526                         goto reprocess;
00527                 }
00528 
00529                 splitted = 1;
00530 
00531                 new2->l_granted_mode = lock->l_granted_mode;
00532                 new2->l_policy_data.l_flock.pid =
00533                         new->l_policy_data.l_flock.pid;
00534                 new2->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner =
00535                         new->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner;
00536                 new2->l_policy_data.l_flock.start =
00537                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start;
00538                 new2->l_policy_data.l_flock.end =
00539                         new->l_policy_data.l_flock.start - 1;
00540                 lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start =
00541                         new->l_policy_data.l_flock.end + 1;
00542                 new2->l_conn_export = lock->l_conn_export;
00543                 if (lock->l_export != NULL) {
00544                         new2->l_export = class_export_lock_get(lock->l_export, new2);
00545                         if (new2->l_export->exp_lock_hash &&
00546                             hlist_unhashed(&new2->l_exp_hash))
00547                                 cfs_hash_add(new2->l_export->exp_lock_hash,
00548                                              &new2->l_remote_handle,
00549                                              &new2->l_exp_hash);
00550                 }
00551                 if (*flags == LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC)
00552                         ldlm_lock_addref_internal_nolock(new2,
00553                                                          lock->l_granted_mode);
00554 
00555                 /* insert new2 at lock */
00556                 ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, ownlocks, new2);
00557                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(new2);
00558                 break;
00559         }
00560 
00561         /* if new2 is created but never used, destroy it*/
00562         if (splitted == 0 && new2 != NULL)
00563                 ldlm_lock_destroy_nolock(new2);
00564 
00565         /* At this point we're granting the lock request. */
00566         req->l_granted_mode = req->l_req_mode;
00567 
00568         /* Add req to the granted queue before calling ldlm_reprocess_all(). */
00569         if (!added) {
00570                 list_del_init(&req->l_res_link);
00571                 /* insert new lock before ownlocks in list. */
00572                 ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, ownlocks, req);
00573         }
00574 
00575         if (*flags != LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC) {
00576 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00577                 if (first_enq) {
00578                         /* If this is an unlock, reprocess the waitq and
00579                          * send completions ASTs for locks that can now be
00580                          * granted. The only problem with doing this
00581                          * reprocessing here is that the completion ASTs for
00582                          * newly granted locks will be sent before the unlock
00583                          * completion is sent. It shouldn't be an issue. Also
00584                          * note that ldlm_process_flock_lock() will recurse,
00585                          * but only once because first_enq will be false from
00586                          * ldlm_reprocess_queue. */
00587                         if ((mode == LCK_NL) && overlaps) {
00588                                 struct list_head rpc_list;
00589                                 int rc;
00590 
00591                                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rpc_list);
00592 restart:
00593                                 ldlm_reprocess_queue(res, &res->lr_waiting,
00594                                                      &rpc_list);
00595 
00596                                 unlock_res_and_lock(req);
00597                                 rc = ldlm_run_ast_work(ns, &rpc_list,
00598                                                        LDLM_WORK_CP_AST);
00599                                 lock_res_and_lock(req);
00600                                 if (rc == -ERESTART)
00601                                         GOTO(restart, rc);
00602                        }
00603                 } else {
00604                         LASSERT(req->l_completion_ast);
00605                         ldlm_add_ast_work_item(req, NULL, work_list);
00606                 }
00607 #else /* !HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00608                 /* The only one possible case for client-side calls flock
00609                  * policy function is ldlm_flock_completion_ast inside which
00610                  * carries LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC flag. */
00611                 CERROR("Illegal parameter for client-side-only module.\n");
00612                 LBUG();
00613 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00614         }
00615 
00616         /* In case we're reprocessing the requested lock we can't destroy
00617          * it until after calling ldlm_add_ast_work_item() above so that laawi()
00618          * can bump the reference count on \a req. Otherwise \a req
00619          * could be freed before the completion AST can be sent.  */
00620         if (added)
00621                 ldlm_flock_destroy(req, mode, *flags);
00622 
00623         ldlm_resource_dump(D_INFO, res);
00624         RETURN(LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE);
00625 }
00626 
00627 struct ldlm_flock_wait_data {
00628         struct ldlm_lock *fwd_lock;
00629         int               fwd_generation;
00630 };
00631 
00632 static void
00633 ldlm_flock_interrupted_wait(void *data)
00634 {
00635         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00636         ENTRY;
00637 
00638         lock = ((struct ldlm_flock_wait_data *)data)->fwd_lock;
00639 
00640         /* take lock off the deadlock detection hash list. */
00641         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00642         ldlm_flock_blocking_unlink(lock);
00643 
00644         /* client side - set flag to prevent lock from being put on LRU list */
00645         ldlm_set_cbpending(lock);
00646         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00647 
00648         EXIT;
00649 }
00650 
00661 int
00662 ldlm_flock_completion_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 flags, void *data)
00663 {
00664         struct file_lock *getlk = lock->l_ast_data;
00665         struct obd_device *obd;
00666         struct obd_import *imp = NULL;
00667         struct ldlm_flock_wait_data fwd;
00668         struct l_wait_info lwi;
00669         enum ldlm_error err;
00670         int rc = 0;
00671         ENTRY;
00672 
00673         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CB_WAIT2, 4);
00674         if (OBD_FAIL_PRECHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CB_WAIT3)) {
00675                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00676                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_FAIL_LOC;
00677                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00678                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CB_WAIT3, 4);
00679         }
00680         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "flags: "LPX64" data: %p getlk: %p\n",
00681                flags, data, getlk);
00682 
00683         LASSERT(flags != LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC);
00684 
00685         if (flags & LDLM_FL_FAILED)
00686                 goto granted;
00687 
00688         if (!(flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCKED_MASK)) {
00689                 if (NULL == data)
00690                         /* mds granted the lock in the reply */
00691                         goto granted;
00692                 /* CP AST RPC: lock get granted, wake it up */
00693                 wake_up(&lock->l_waitq);
00694                 RETURN(0);
00695         }
00696 
00697         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue returned a blocked lock, "
00698                    "sleeping");
00699         fwd.fwd_lock = lock;
00700         obd = class_exp2obd(lock->l_conn_export);
00701 
00702         /* if this is a local lock, there is no import */
00703         if (NULL != obd)
00704                 imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00705 
00706         if (NULL != imp) {
00707                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00708                 fwd.fwd_generation = imp->imp_generation;
00709                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00710         }
00711 
00712         lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(0, NULL, ldlm_flock_interrupted_wait, &fwd);
00713 
00714         /* Go to sleep until the lock is granted. */
00715         rc = l_wait_event(lock->l_waitq, is_granted_or_cancelled(lock), &lwi);
00716 
00717         if (rc) {
00718                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue waking up: failed (%d)",
00719                            rc);
00720                 RETURN(rc);
00721         }
00722 
00723 granted:
00724         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CB_WAIT, 10);
00725 
00726         if (OBD_FAIL_PRECHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CB_WAIT4)) {
00727                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00728                 /* DEADLOCK is always set with CBPENDING */
00729                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_FLOCK_DEADLOCK | LDLM_FL_CBPENDING;
00730                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00731                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CB_WAIT4, 4);
00732         }
00733         if (OBD_FAIL_PRECHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CB_WAIT5)) {
00734                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00735                 /* DEADLOCK is always set with CBPENDING */
00736                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_FAIL_LOC |
00737                                  LDLM_FL_FLOCK_DEADLOCK | LDLM_FL_CBPENDING;
00738                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00739                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CB_WAIT5, 4);
00740         }
00741 
00742         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00743 
00744 
00745         /* Protect against race where lock could have been just destroyed
00746          * due to overlap in ldlm_process_flock_lock().
00747          */
00748         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
00749                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00750                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue waking up: destroyed");
00751 
00752                 /* An error is still to be returned, to propagate it up to
00753                  * ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini() caller. */
00754                 RETURN(-EIO);
00755         }
00756 
00757         /* ldlm_lock_enqueue() has already placed lock on the granted list. */
00758         ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
00759 
00760         /* Import invalidation. We need to actually release the lock
00761          * references being held, so that it can go away. No point in
00762          * holding the lock even if app still believes it has it, since
00763          * server already dropped it anyway. Only for granted locks too. */
00764         /* Do the same for DEADLOCK'ed locks. */
00765         if (ldlm_is_failed(lock) || ldlm_is_flock_deadlock(lock)) {
00766                 int mode;
00767 
00768                 if (flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK)
00769                         LASSERT(ldlm_is_test_lock(lock));
00770 
00771                 if (ldlm_is_test_lock(lock) || ldlm_is_flock_deadlock(lock))
00772                         mode = flock_type(getlk);
00773                 else
00774                         mode = lock->l_granted_mode;
00775 
00776                 if (ldlm_is_flock_deadlock(lock)) {
00777                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue deadlock "
00778                                    "received");
00779                         rc = -EDEADLK;
00780                 }
00781                 ldlm_flock_destroy(lock, mode, LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC);
00782                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00783 
00784                 /* Need to wake up the waiter if we were evicted */
00785                 wake_up(&lock->l_waitq);
00786 
00787                 /* An error is still to be returned, to propagate it up to
00788                  * ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini() caller. */
00789                 RETURN(rc ? : -EIO);
00790         }
00791 
00792         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue granted");
00793 
00794         if (flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK) {
00795                 /* fcntl(F_GETLK) request */
00796                 /* The old mode was saved in getlk->fl_type so that if the mode
00797                  * in the lock changes we can decref the appropriate refcount.*/
00798                 LASSERT(ldlm_is_test_lock(lock));
00799                 ldlm_flock_destroy(lock, flock_type(getlk),
00800                                    LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC);
00801                 switch (lock->l_granted_mode) {
00802                 case LCK_PR:
00803                         flock_set_type(getlk, F_RDLCK);
00804                         break;
00805                 case LCK_PW:
00806                         flock_set_type(getlk, F_WRLCK);
00807                         break;
00808                 default:
00809                         flock_set_type(getlk, F_UNLCK);
00810                 }
00811                 flock_set_pid(getlk, (pid_t)lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.pid);
00812                 flock_set_start(getlk,
00813                                 (loff_t)lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start);
00814                 flock_set_end(getlk,
00815                               (loff_t)lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end);
00816         } else {
00817                 __u64 noreproc = LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC;
00818 
00819                 /* We need to reprocess the lock to do merges or splits
00820                  * with existing locks owned by this process. */
00821                 ldlm_process_flock_lock(lock, &noreproc, 1, &err, NULL);
00822         }
00823         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00824         RETURN(rc);
00825 }
00826 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_flock_completion_ast);
00827 
00828 int ldlm_flock_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc,
00829                             void *data, int flag)
00830 {
00831         ENTRY;
00832 
00833         LASSERT(lock);
00834         LASSERT(flag == LDLM_CB_CANCELING);
00835 
00836         /* take lock off the deadlock detection hash list. */
00837         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00838         ldlm_flock_blocking_unlink(lock);
00839         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00840         RETURN(0);
00841 }
00842 
00843 void ldlm_flock_policy_wire_to_local(const union ldlm_wire_policy_data *wpolicy,
00844                                      union ldlm_policy_data *lpolicy)
00845 {
00846         memset(lpolicy, 0, sizeof(*lpolicy));
00847         lpolicy->l_flock.start = wpolicy->l_flock.lfw_start;
00848         lpolicy->l_flock.end = wpolicy->l_flock.lfw_end;
00849         lpolicy->l_flock.pid = wpolicy->l_flock.lfw_pid;
00850         lpolicy->l_flock.owner = wpolicy->l_flock.lfw_owner;
00851 }
00852 
00853 void ldlm_flock_policy_local_to_wire(const union ldlm_policy_data *lpolicy,
00854                                      union ldlm_wire_policy_data *wpolicy)
00855 {
00856         memset(wpolicy, 0, sizeof(*wpolicy));
00857         wpolicy->l_flock.lfw_start = lpolicy->l_flock.start;
00858         wpolicy->l_flock.lfw_end = lpolicy->l_flock.end;
00859         wpolicy->l_flock.lfw_pid = lpolicy->l_flock.pid;
00860         wpolicy->l_flock.lfw_owner = lpolicy->l_flock.owner;
00861 }
00862 
00863 /*
00864  * Export handle<->flock hash operations.
00865  */
00866 static unsigned
00867 ldlm_export_flock_hash(struct cfs_hash *hs, const void *key, unsigned mask)
00868 {
00869         return cfs_hash_u64_hash(*(__u64 *)key, mask);
00870 }
00871 
00872 static void *
00873 ldlm_export_flock_key(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00874 {
00875         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00876 
00877         lock = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_flock_hash);
00878         return &lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.owner;
00879 }
00880 
00881 static int
00882 ldlm_export_flock_keycmp(const void *key, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00883 {
00884         return !memcmp(ldlm_export_flock_key(hnode), key, sizeof(__u64));
00885 }
00886 
00887 static void *
00888 ldlm_export_flock_object(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00889 {
00890         return hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_flock_hash);
00891 }
00892 
00893 static void
00894 ldlm_export_flock_get(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00895 {
00896         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00897         struct ldlm_flock *flock;
00898 
00899         lock = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_flock_hash);
00900         LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
00901 
00902         flock = &lock->l_policy_data.l_flock;
00903         LASSERT(flock->blocking_export != NULL);
00904         class_export_get(flock->blocking_export);
00905         flock->blocking_refs++;
00906 }
00907 
00908 static void
00909 ldlm_export_flock_put(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00910 {
00911         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00912         struct ldlm_flock *flock;
00913 
00914         lock = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_flock_hash);
00915         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00916 
00917         flock = &lock->l_policy_data.l_flock;
00918         LASSERT(flock->blocking_export != NULL);
00919         class_export_put(flock->blocking_export);
00920         if (--flock->blocking_refs == 0) {
00921                 flock->blocking_owner = 0;
00922                 flock->blocking_export = NULL;
00923         }
00924 }
00925 
00926 static struct cfs_hash_ops ldlm_export_flock_ops = {
00927         .hs_hash        = ldlm_export_flock_hash,
00928         .hs_key         = ldlm_export_flock_key,
00929         .hs_keycmp      = ldlm_export_flock_keycmp,
00930         .hs_object      = ldlm_export_flock_object,
00931         .hs_get         = ldlm_export_flock_get,
00932         .hs_put         = ldlm_export_flock_put,
00933         .hs_put_locked  = ldlm_export_flock_put,
00934 };
00935 
00936 int ldlm_init_flock_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00937 {
00938         if( strcmp(exp->exp_obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_MDT_NAME) != 0)
00939                 RETURN(0);
00940 
00941         exp->exp_flock_hash =
00942                 cfs_hash_create(obd_uuid2str(&exp->exp_client_uuid),
00943                                 HASH_EXP_LOCK_CUR_BITS,
00944                                 HASH_EXP_LOCK_MAX_BITS,
00945                                 HASH_EXP_LOCK_BKT_BITS, 0,
00946                                 CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA, CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
00947                                 &ldlm_export_flock_ops,
00948                                 CFS_HASH_DEFAULT | CFS_HASH_NBLK_CHANGE);
00949         if (!exp->exp_flock_hash)
00950                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00951 
00952         RETURN(0);
00953 }
00954 
00955 void ldlm_destroy_flock_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00956 {
00957         ENTRY;
00958         if (exp->exp_flock_hash) {
00959                 cfs_hash_putref(exp->exp_flock_hash);
00960                 exp->exp_flock_hash = NULL;
00961         }
00962         EXIT;
00963 }
